lead_paragraph: Investors claim Signature helped a money manager pull off a $66 million fraud by ordering him to shift money around accounts he held at the bank to cover overdrafts.

headline.print_headline: Signature Bank Is Sued Over Ties to Ponzi Scheme
headline.main: Signature Bank Sued Over Connection to Ponzi Scheme

snippet: Investors claim Signature helped a money manager pull off a $66 million fraud by ordering him to shift money around accounts he held at the bank to cover overdrafts.
abstract: Investors are suing Signature Bank in Florida state court, accusing it of helping money manager William Landberg run Ponzi scheme that lost $66 million of investor money.
